measured_by: Dichotomous moral acceptability question – “Is it morally acceptable for the doctor to give the last ventilator to the younger patient?”
justification: In Stage Two, “Participants then indicated their moral judgment using both a dichotomous measure ("Is it morally acceptable for the doctor to give the last ventilator to the younger patient?").”

measured_by: Likert-type moral acceptability scale – “To what extent is it morally acceptable for the doctor to give the last ventilator to the younger patient?”
justification: The Method notes a second dependent measure: “and a scale measure ("To what extent is it morally acceptable for the doctor to give the last ventilator to the younger patient?").”

measured_by: Dichotomous preference question – “Do you want the doctor to give the last ventilator to the younger patient?”
justification: For participants in the VOI condition, Stage One required them to state their self-interested preference using a dichotomous item: “Participants in the VOI condition indicated what they would like the doctor to do… (‘Do you want the doctor to give the last ventilator to the younger patient?’).”

measured_by: Preference strength scale – “To what extent do you want the doctor to give the last ventilator to the younger patient?”
justification: The same VOI section adds a parallel scale measure: “and a scale measure (‘To what extent do you want the doctor to give the last ventilator to the younger patient?’).”
